item.title: Report E-2025040129
item.description:
Report E-2025040129

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-06T01:06:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-07
  • City: SLC
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 7, 2025, one (1) 275-gallon tote of UN2582 had a loose cap and released approximately one (1) pint to the trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the site. The crew replaced the cap and utilized absorbents to collect the spent product. All impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2025040106
item.description:
Report E-2025040106

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-06T01:06:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-03
  • City: SALT LAKE CITY
  • State: UT
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L TRANSFER, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 3, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of adhesive was crushed and released approximately four (4) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from GrayMar Environmental Services (GES) to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the trailer. GES also cut up the impacted pallet. All impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum and the damaged drum of product was placed in one (1) 85-gallon salvage drum.
